transportAdvice: Bermuda has a public bus network and ferry service that connect most tourist areas across the island, making them practical options for getting around without a car. Taxis are widely available, and renting a scooter or electric bicycle is a popular way to explore, as private car rentals are not permitted for tourists.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally breezy with mild temperatures; the coolest month of the year but still relatively mild compared to mainland destinations.
Similar to January, with cool temperatures and occasional rain; not ideal for swimming but pleasant for sightseeing.
Temperatures begin to inch upward with a mix of sunny and overcast days; a quieter time to visit before the spring rush.
Spring arrives with warmer days and blooming flora; comfortable for outdoor activities though the ocean remains cool for swimming.
Warm and increasingly sunny; a popular month to visit as beach conditions improve and crowds have not yet peaked.
Early summer brings warm, humid weather ideal for beach and water activities; the start of the Atlantic hurricane season warrants monitoring.
Hot and humid with plenty of sunshine; peak beach season with warm turquoise waters and lively atmosphere.
The hottest month of the year with high humidity; excellent for water sports but tropical storm activity is possible.
Peak hurricane season brings the highest risk of storms and heavy rain; travel insurance and flexible plans are strongly advised.
Temperatures ease and hurricane risk decreases; a pleasant month with warm seas and fewer crowds than summer.
Mild and comfortable with cooling temperatures; a good shoulder season option for those seeking quieter beaches and lower rates.
Cool and festive with holiday events on the island; not ideal for swimming but enjoyable for exploring Bermuda's towns and culture.
